adoption of florida uniform traffic control law there is hereby adopted by reference the florida uniform traffic control law of the florida statutes which shall be in full force and effect in the city as if printed herein adoption and validation of traffic regulations existing at adoption of traffic regulations within the city existing at the time of the adoption of this that are evidenced by proper signs paintings markers signals and other devices are hereby ratified validated and adopted as part of this chapter and the same shall remain in force and effect until changed in a manner as provided by law and a violation of any such regulation shall be deemed a violation of law and as such is punishable under state law  powers and duties of chief of police to regulate traffic a the chief of police by and with the consent of the city manager except as otherwise directed by this chapter and except as otherwise directed from time to time by the city council and city manager shall have power and he is hereby authorized to regulate the operation and parking of vehicles within the corporate limits of the city by the erection or placing of signs signals markers markings and other authorized trafficcontrol devices in the following specified instances 1 designation of areas where parking is prohibited or limited  2 designation of oneway streets stop streets uturns play streets school zones hospital zones quiet zones crosswalks safety zones and truck routes  3 installation and proper timing and maintenance of trafficcontrol devices  4 marking off of traffic lanes indicating the flow of traffic  5 closing of streets to vehicular or pedestrian traffic for temporary period of time  6 regulation of traffic during emergencies notwithstanding other regulations b yellow paint or markings on any street or curbing shall mean that parking is prohibited in that area so marked  provided however areas marked with yellow paint and designated as a loading zone shall be permitted to be used for that purpose or for whatever purpose so designated c the existence of such signs signals markers or markings at any place within the corporate limits of the city shall be prima facie evidence that such signs or markers were erected or placed by and at the direction of the chief of police and city manager and in accordance with the provisions of this chapter d any person failing or refusing to comply with the directions indicated on any sign or marker erected or placed in accordance with the provisions of this section when so placed or erected shall be in violation of this punished as provided in section 111  cross reference police ch 23 permits for parades and processions required  exception a no funeral procession or parade containing two hundred 200 or more persons or fifty 50 or more vehicles excepting the forces of the united states army navy or air force the military forces of this state and the forces of the police and fire departments shall occupy march or proceed along any street except in accordance with a permit issued by the city manager and such other regulations as are set forth herein which may apply b whenever the city manager gives a permit for any parade public gathering or celebration he may order any street or portion of street to be cleared of all vehicles during the parade public gathering or celebration  riding bicycles on sidewalks prohibited it shall be unlawful for anyone to ride a bicycle on the sidewalks or boardwalks in the city  state law reference bicycle regulations fs   failure to obey notice or summons a any person who violates his written promise to appear given to an officer upon an arrest for any traffic violation is guilty of a misdemeanor regardless of the disposition of the charge on which he was originally arrested b any driver of a motor vehicle who willfully neglects to answer to charges set forth in a notice affixed to such motor vehicle by a police officer as provided by any ordinance of this city is guilty of the charge for which the notice was originally issued  secs 3173117  reserved article ii  operation of vehicles speed restrictions a no person shall drive a vehicle on a street at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent under the conditions then existing b where no special hazard exists the following speeds shall be lawful but any speed in excess of said limits shall be prima facie evidence that the speed is not reasonable or prudent and is unlawful 1 fifteen 15 miles per hour in any business district  2 twentyfive 25 miles per hour in any residence district  3 fifteen 15 miles per hour in a school zone  4 ten 10 miles per hour on the public beach east of the established seawalls  5 at any intersections where no trafficcontrol devices are located the speed limit shall be onehalf 12 of the maximum permitted on the specific street while traversing the intersection  6 the city manager shall be empowered to designate speed restrictions in any area adjacent to a congested residential area as long as the speeds conform with state speed laws c the fact that the speed of a vehicle is lower than the foregoing limits shall not relieve the driver from the duty to decrease speed when approaching and crossing an intersection when approaching and going around a curve when approaching a hillcrest when traveling upon any narrow or winding roadway or when special hazard exists with respect to pedestrians or other traffic or by reason of weather or highway conditions and speed shall be decreased as may be necessary to avoid colliding with any person vehicle or other conveyance on or entering the street in compliance with legal requirements and the duty of all persons to use due care d in every charge of violation of this section the complaint also the summons or notice to appear shall specify the speed at which the defendant is alleged to have driven also the prima facie speed applicable within the district or at the location e the foregoing provisions of this section shall not be construed to relieve the plaintiff in any civil action from the burden of proving negligence upon the part of the defendant as the proximate cause of an accident  state law reference establishment of state speed zones fs    establishment of municipal and county speed zones fs    unlawful speed fs    establishment of school speed zones fs   slowmoving vehicles all vehicles moving slowly along the street shall keep as close as possible to the curbline so as to allow fastmoving vehicles free passage on the lefthand side  reserved editors note loading zoning requirements  341801 et seq state law reference stopping standing or parking prohibited in specified places fs    additional parking regulations fs   division 1  generally unlawful parking no person shall stand or park a vehicle upon any roadway for the principal purpose of 1 displaying it for sale  2 washing greasing or repairing vehicle except repairs necessitated by an emergency  standing for loading only a no person shall stop stand or park a vehicle for any purpose or period of time other than for the expeditious loading or unloading of passengers in any place marked as a passenger zone during the hours when the regulations applicable to such passenger zone are effective and then only for a period not to exceed three 3 minutes b no person shall stop stand or park a vehicle for any purpose or length of time other than for the expeditious unloading and delivery or pickup and loading of materials in any place marked as a loading zone during hours when the provisions applicable to loading zones are in effect in no case shall the stop for loading and unloading of materials exceed thirty 30 minutes  allowance for free movement for vehicular traffic a no person shall stop stand or park any vehicle upon a street other than an alley in such manner or under such conditions as to leave available less than ten 10 feet of the width of the roadway for free movement of vehicular traffic except that a driver may stop temporarily during the actual loading or unloading of passengers or when necessary in obedience to traffic regulations or traffic signs or signals or a police officer b no person shall park a vehicle within an alley for over fifteen 15 minutes unless there is left available not less than eight 8 feet of the width of the roadway for the free movement of vehicular traffic  bus and taxicab stands a the driver of a bus or taxicab shall not stand or park upon any street in any business district at any place other than at a bus stop or taxicab stand respectively except that this provision shall not prevent the driver of any such vehicle from temporarily stopping in accordance with other stopping or parking regulations at any place for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading passengers b no person shall stop stand or park a vehicle other than a bus in a bus stop or other than a taxicab in a taxicab stand when any such stop or stand has been officially designated and appropriately signed except that the driver of a passenger vehicle may temporarily stop therein for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading passengers when such stopping does not interfere with any bus or taxicab waiting to enter or about to enter such zone  maximum parking time no person who owns or has possession custody or control of any vehicle shall park such vehicle on any street or alley of this city for more than a consecutive period of sixty 60 hours  owner responsible for illegal parking no person shall allow permit or suffer any vehicle registered in his name to stand or park in any street in this city in violation of any of the ordinances of this city regulating the standing or parking of vehicles  safety zone designated a the hereinafterdescribed portions of the atlantic ocean shore and beach lying between the waters of the atlantic ocean and the established concrete bulkhead lying westerly thereof are hereby designated created established and set aside as safety zones or protective areas within which operation of any and every type of motordriven vehicle shall be prohibited from the southernmost boundary line of the territorial limits of the city northerly to the northernmost boundary line of the territorial limits of the city b the abovedescribed safety zones or protective areas shall be closed off from all vehicular traffic by the erection of appropriate barricades guards and signs to place the public on notice of the existence of the safety zones or protective areas and of the prohibition against motor vehicles using the areas and any and every type of motordriven vehicle shall be prohibited and forbidden from using riding on or driving upon any part or portion of said safety zone or protective area except on such occasions as the city manager deems necessary c any person who operates a vehicle in violation of the provisions of this section shall upon conviction thereof be punished by a fine not to exceed one hundred dollars $10000 or by imprisonment not to exceed seventyfive 75 days or by both such fine and imprisonment    7279 oversized vehicles a definitions 1 vehicle every device in upon or by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a city street city rightofway cityowned parking lot or cityowned property 2 oversized vehicle any vehicle measuring more than twentytwo 22 feet in overall length as rated by the manufacturer or having a manufacturers gross vehicle weight rating of ten thousand 10000 pounds or more b general regulations 1 except as provided all vehicles measuring more than twentytwo 22 feet in overall length as rated by the manufacturer or having a manufacturers gross vehicle weight rating of ten thousand 10000 pounds or more are prohibited from parking on any city street or rightofway cityowned parking lot or cityowned property in the area bounded by a1a third street from the curb line on the east side of a1a third street east to the bulkhead line of the city  and from sixteenth avenue south north to sixteenth avenue north inclusive 2 notwithstanding the requirements of b1 oversized vehicles measuring more than twentytwo 22 feet in overall length as rated by the manufacturer or having a manufacturers gross vehicle weight rating of ten thousand 10000 pounds or more are authorized to park on any city street or rightofway within the boundaries stated in b 1 for purposes of regular and continuous loading andor unloading of such vehicles between the hours of  am pm  provided such parking allows for free movement of traffic as set forth in section 3134 3 the following vehicles are exempt from the provisions of this section a school buses of public or private schools while on official school business b oversized vehicles which have been issued a permit by the city in connection with a citysponsored special event or c vehicles owned or operated by the city or other governmental agency 4 any oversized vehicle found to be in violation of this section is subject to being towed at the owners expense without prior notice c penalty any person violating any provision of this section shall be guilty of an offense punishable by a fine of fifty dollars $5000 per violation payable within ten 10 days to the utility billing office city hall or the records clerk police department jacksonville beach florida a late fee of ten dollars $1000 shall be attached to any fine not paid by the due date  31504 secs 31403145  reserved division 2  impounding vehicles footnotes  3  editors note  adopted  amended div 3 to read as set out in  31463155 formerly div 3  31463150 was derived from  239823101 cross reference junked abandoned vehicles  1416 et seq authority to impound and store certain vehicles a the chief of police or any police officer may cause to be impounded 1 any motor vehicle unlawfully parked in violation of any provision of the city ordinances which prohibits the parking of vehicles at the place where or time when the impounded motor vehicle is found 2 any motor vehicle which a is a stolen motor vehicle  or b is subject to seizure and forfeiture under the laws of the state  or c is subject to being held for use as evidence in a criminal trial 3 any motor vehicle the continued presence of which because of the physical location or condition of the motor vehicle poses a danger to the public safety or to the motor vehicle b the city is authorized to maintain a public storage place for all motor vehicles impounded pursuant to this section but the chief of police may also authorize storage of such impounded motor vehicles at any other location public or private which is zoned for the storage of motor vehicles  41679 notice of impoundment a when owner present when the police intended to impound a motor vehicle pursuant to section 3146 and the owner of the motor vehicle is then present the police shall before the motor vehicle is removed provide the owner with a notice in the form prescribed by the chief of police that the motor vehicle is being impounded that towing and storage charges will be assessed against the impounded motor vehicle that the owner may claim and regain possession of the impounded motor vehicle at the location to which it is being removed for storage without prepayment of towing and storage charges and that the owner may request a hearing as to the propriety of the impoundment and as to the amount of and the owners liability for the towing and storage charges the notice shall also state in prominent language that failure by the owner to request a hearing within five 5 days after receipt of the notice may act as a waiver of his right to a hearing and that this may result in the placing of a lien against the motor vehicle for the towing and storage charges without further notice to the owner the owner of the impounded motor vehicle shall sign the notice as an acknowledgement that he has received a copy of the notice and a copy of the notice shall be provided to the owner b when owner not present 1 when the police impound and remove a motor vehicle and the owner of the motor vehicle is not present at the time of impoundment the police shall if the owner resides in the city as appears from the motor vehicle registration immediately serve upon the owner of the impounded motor vehicle at the address on the motor vehicle registration a notice in the form prescribed by the chief of police containing the same information as required by subsection a service shall be made as provided by law for service of process generally if the owner cannot be found at the address on the motor vehicle registration and there is no other known address of the owner he shall be deemed to be a resident of the state whose whereabouts are unknown and service shall be made on the secretary of state as provided in florida statutes 2 if the owner does not reside in the city as appears from the motor vehicle registration the owner shall be deemed to be either a resident of the state whose whereabouts are unknown or a nonresident of the state and service shall be made on the secretary of state as provided in florida statutes c failure or refusal to sign notice if any person required by this section to sign a notice of impoundment willfully fails or refuses to do so or if such person cannot be found the police shall note this fact on the face of the notice which shall constitute prima facie evidence of delivery or service of notice as required by this section  41679 impoundment after request to leave motor vehicle in all cases where the owner of a motor vehicle which is on a public street has requested that the motor vehicle be left unattended at that location in lieu of impoundment of the vehicle the police may honor said request for a period of time not exceeding twentyfour 24 hours after which time the motor vehicle shall either be removed from the location by the owner or operator or be impounded by the police the police shall be immune from liability for any damage loss or destruction of the motor vehicle occasioned by its being left unattended pursuant to the request of the owner or operator thereof in lieu of impoundment nothing in this section shall be construed to limit the authority of the police to order the removal of a motor vehicle by its owner or operator or to impound a motor vehicle at any time whenever in his judgment the presence of the unattended motor vehicle constitutes a danger to the public safety  41679 release of motor vehicle from impoundment a generally the owner of an impounded motor vehicle may secure the release of the motor vehicle from impoundment upon requesting such release and presenting proof of ownership to the police department if the person making the request is the owner or his authorized agent he shall be given a release to present to the custodian of the place where the vehicle is stored nothing in this section shall preclude the owner of the impounded motor vehicle or his agent from paying any towing and storage charges that may be assessed against the motor vehicle but neither the police nor the custodian of the storage space may require payment of any towing or storage charges as a condition precedent to such release at the same time as the owner or his agent requests release of the impounded motor vehicle and if such request is made within forty 40 days after the owner receives a copy of the notice of impoundment the police shall provide him an opportunity to make a request for a hearing on the propriety of the impoundment and on the amount and his liability for the towing and storage charges occasioned by the impoundment  provided that if the owner receives a copy of the notice of impoundment no hearing may be requested on the impoundment or on the towing and storage charges and the owner shall be conclusively presumed to have consented to the impoundment and to the amount of and his liability for the towing and storage charges b security for payment of charges if the ownership of the impounded vehicle is evidenced by a title certificate issued by the florida department of highway safety and motor vehicles the owner or his agent may secure the release of the motor vehicle from impoundment without the payment of any towing or storage charges or the deposit of any security for the payment thereof if the ownership of the impounded motor vehicle is evidenced by a foreign title instrument or if the jurisdiction in which title is recorded is not evident from the document establishing ownership the owner or his agent before the custodian of the place where the motor vehicle is stored authorizes release of the motor vehicle from impoundment shall deposit with the custodian cash in the amount of the towing and storage charges to the date of the request if the owner or his agent refuses to provide the cash deposit the custodian shall not authorize release of the impounded motor vehicle but if the request is timely made a date shall be set for the hearing on the impoundment and charges  41679 hearing if the owner of an impounded motor vehicle or his agent timely requests the release of the motor vehicle from impoundment and a hearing on the impoundment and charges a date shall be set not more than five 5 days after the date of request for the hearing the city clerk shall provide a hearing examiner to conduct the hearing required by this section such person shall be thoroughly familiar with the applicable ordinances of the city of jacksonville beach although not required to have formal legal training the person so designated must familiarize himself with the applicable rules governing administrative hearings such person should possess the ability to listen attentively to persons giving testimony and be able to exercise mature judgment and tact and must be able to express himself clearly and concisely orally and in writing at the hearing the owner his agent or his attorney shall be afforded an opportunity to present by oral testimony or documentary evidence his objections to a the impoundment of the motor vehicle and b1 the amount of the towing charges and 2 his liability for the payment thereof if the owner or his agent requested the hearing more than five 5 days but not more than forty 40 days after the owner received a copy of the notice of impoundment the owner his agent or his attorney shall be required at the hearing as a condition precedent to the presentation of any objections by the owner to show good cause for the delay in making the request more than five 5 days after the owner received a copy of the notice of impoundment  if good cause cannot be shown the hearing officer shall dismiss the hearing and make the finding stated in subsection 2 below  otherwise the hearing examiner shall proceed to hear the owners objections at the conclusion of the hearing on the owners objections the hearing examiner shall render his decision if the hearing examiner 1 finds that the impoundment was improper he shall a find that the owner is not liable for any towing or storage charges occasioned by the impoundment  and b determine whether and to what extent the city shall bear the expense of the towing and storage charges  or 2 finds that the impoundment was proper he shall establish a the amount of the towing and storage charges to be assessed against the impounded motor vehicle  and b the extent of the liability of the owner for payment of the towing and storage charges so established the decision of the hearing examiner shall be final and a copy of the decision shall be furnished to the owner of the impounded motor vehicle to the custodian of the place where the motor vehicle is stored and to the police department  41679 towing and storage charges to constitute lien  limitations the towing and storage charges occasioned by the impoundment of a motor vehicle shall be and constitute a lien upon the impounded motor vehicle except as provided in this section if the hearing examiner finds that the impoundment was improper and if he determines that the city shall bear part or all of the towing and storage charges the lien created by this section shall be discharged if the hearing examiner finds that the impoundment was proper but that the towing and storage charges should be in an amount less than the amount of the lien the lien created by this section shall be discharged to the extent that it exceeds the amount established by the hearing examiner the holder of a lien created by this section may perfect such lien in any manner provided by law but he may not retain possession of the motor vehicle when it has been released in the event that the impounded motor vehicle is released from impoundment and the owner or his agent has provided security for payment of charges as required the lien created by this section shall also be a lien against the security so provided subject to being wholly or partially discharged as provided in this section  41679 satisfaction of lien  notice of public sale the holder of a lien against a motor vehicle to the extent that such lien has not been discharged as provided or otherwise satisfied may enforce such lien in any manner provided by law after sixty 60 days from the date of the motor vehicle is impounded if the owner of the motor vehicle or his agent has provided security for the payment of the lien the lien shall first be satisfied out of the security so provided and if any portion of the lien remains unsatisfied and undischarged may then be enforced in any manner provided by law if the motor vehicle against which the lien is created is still under impoundment sixty 60 days from the date it is impounded and the owner has not requested release of the motor vehicle from impoundment nor paid the towing and storage charges that are the basis for the lien the motor vehicle shall be sold at public sale to the highest and best bidder for cash to satisfy the lien notice of the sale shall be given in writing to the owner and any person claiming a lien on the motor vehicle shown by the records of the state division of motor vehicles and by publication one time in a daily newspaper of general circulation in the city at least ten 10 days prior to the date of the sale this publication may be made before the termination of the sixtyday period for a sale thereafter if the sale is to be conducted by the city as holder of a lien created the time and place of the sale shall be fixed by the city clerk who shall give notice of and conduct the sale in the name and on behalf of the city  41679 establishment of rotating wrecker call list the chief of police subject to approval by the city manager is authorized to establish standards and rules for the administration of a rotating wrecker call list to provide safe and dependable wrecker service to the city all wrecker and towing firms companies or corporations licensed to conduct that business with the city may apply for a listing by the police department on the rotating wrecker call list  41679 wrecker equipment  insurance  fees a all wreckers must be equipped at all times with amber flashing lights and all necessary working tools including but not limited to bolt cutters crowbars shovel broom axe and fire extinguisher b all wreckers must have maintain and keep in full force and effect liability insurance in an amount not less than one million dollars $100000000 combined single limit liability coverage  to include general liability personal injury and property damage required insurance shall be documented in certificates of insurance which provide that the city shall be notified at least thirty 30 days in advance of cancellation nonrenewal or adverse change new certificates of insurance are to be provided to the city at least fifteen 15 days prior to coverage renewals if requested by the city the other party shall furnish complete copies of the other partys insurance policies forms and endorsements certificates are to be mailed to chief of police jacksonville beach police department 101 south penman road jacksonville beach fl 32250 c fees that wrecker companies may charge for the towing and storage of vehicles shall be adopted by the city council by resolution  2 8182008 editors note  2 adopted aug 18 200 repealed the former  3154 and enacted a new  3154 as set out herein the former  3154 pertained to charges for towing and storage  wrecker equipment  insurance and derived from  41679   41894   21901   business site requirements no person firm company or corporation will be considered by the jacksonville beach police department if the following condition exists place of business is not inside the city of jacksonville beach  41894 repairing vehicles without authorization prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to dismantle or to make any repairs alterations or additions to any such removed vehicle without the written consent signed by its owner or his duly authorized agent  41679 immobilizing of vehicles a the chief of police or his designee is authorized to attach or cause to be attached a device that is capable of immobilizing a motor vehicle so that it cannot be removed under its own power without damage to the motor vehicle 1 when four 4 or more citations for unlawful or illegal parking involving any motor vehicle bearing the license plate that has been cited have been outstanding for more than thirty 30 days and have not been disposed of by payment of the fine or cancellation of the citations as provided for in section 3169 2 when ten 10 or more daily parking tickets have been incurred on any city parking facility have been outstanding for more than thirty 30 days and have not been resolved by payment b the immobilizing device shall be attached to the motor vehicle at the place where it is found except that no motor vehicle shall be immobilized within the traveled portion of a street or on a portion of a street when immobilization at that place would create a hazard to the public or to traffic on the street at the same time as the immobilizing device is attached to the motor vehicle a notice shall be affixed to the windshield or other prominent place on the motor vehicle stating that the immobilizing device has been so attached cautioning the operator not to attempt to operate the motor vehicle while the immobilizing device is still attached and informing the owner or operator of the motor vehicle of the number and age of and total fines and charges assessable under the citations for which the motor vehicle is immobilized including the removal charge for removal of the immobilizing device and where he must go in order to pay the fines and charges and have the immobilizing device removed from the motor vehicle c the immobilizing device shall be removed from the motor vehicle upon payment of the total fines and charges for which the motor vehicle is immobilized the violator shall pay all incurred fines including an additional ten dollar $1000 fine for each outstanding citation and a twentyfive dollar $2500 removal fee for the removal of the immobilizing device d the chief of police or his designee may tow or cause to be towed and impounded a motor vehicle immobilized under this section if payment of fines and charges or satisfactory arrangements in lieu thereof have not been paid or obtained within twentyfour 24 hours of the attaching of the immobilization device all expenses for towing or impounding shall be borne by the owner of the motor vehicle all towing or impounding hereunder shall be done in accordance with division 2 of chapter 31 of the ordinances  61592   10592   122093 reserved division 3  parking regulations footnotes  4  cross reference schedule of taxes and regulations  1513 definitions the following words and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them operator shall mean and include every individual who shall operate a vehicle as the owner thereof or as the agent employee or permittee of the owner or is in actual physical control of a vehicle park or parking shall mean the standing of a vehicle whether occupied or not upon a street otherwise than temporarily for the purpose of and while actually engaged in receiving or discharging passengers or loading or unloading merchandise or in obedience to traffic regulations signs or signals or an involuntary stopping of the vehicle by reason of causes beyond the control of the operator of the vehicle parking lot shall mean any area of land not a part of a public street set aside or designated for the parking of vehicles street shall mean any public street avenue road alley highway lane path or other public place located in the city and established for the use of vehicles vehicle shall mean any device in upon or by which any person or property is or may be transported upon a highway except a device which is operated upon rails or tracks    21901 cross reference definitions generally  12 reserved editors note  adopted feb 19 200 repealed  3159 former  3159 pertained to parking meters and derived from  designation of parking spaces the city manager is hereby directed and authorized to mark off individual parking spaces on any city street or in any cityowned parking lot as defined in section 3158 at each space so marked off it shall be unlawful to park any vehicle in such a way that the vehicle shall not be entirely within the limits of the space so designated    21901   reserved editors note  adopted feb 19 200 repealed  31613170 formerly these provisions pertained to parking meters and derived from    41679   4780   51683   7185   72385 enforcement it shall be the duty of the police department to enforce the provisions of this division  reservation of powers nothing in this division shall be construed as prohibiting the city from providing for bus stops for taxicab stands and other matters of similar nature including the loading or unloading of trucks vans or other commercial vehicles  exercise of police power this entire division shall be deemed and construed to be an exercise of the police power of the city for the preservation and protection of public safety and all of its provisions shall be liberally construed with a view to the effectuation of such purposes  penalty for violations a the following fees shall be paid for the violations listed to the city clerk city hall jacksonville beach florida parking violation fee if paid within ten days fee if not paid by due date overtime parking $ 2500 $ 3500 parking prohibited area 2500 3500 parking within 15 feet of a fire hydrant 2500 3500 improper parking 2500 3500 parking double 2500 3500 obstructing traffic 2500 3500 obstructing driveway 2500 3500 leaving ignition unlocked or keys in car 2500 3500 parking in designated fire zone 2500 3500 unauthorized parking in handicapped zone 25000 26000 b any person who shall violate or fail to comply with any of the provisions of this division or who shall counsel aid or abet such violation or failure to comply shall be deemed guilty of an offense and shall be punished by a fine of not to exceed one hundred dollars $10000 or by imprisonment for not to exceed thirty 30 days either or both penalties to be imposed at the discretion of the court    12185   7687   10791   7202009 unauthorized parking in disabled space prohibited it shall be unlawful for a person to park stop or stand a vehicle in a parking space designated in accordance with the provisions of section  or section  florida statutes for use only by the disabled unless the vehicle displays a parking permit issued pursuant to section  florida statutes and the vehicle is transporting a person eligible for the parking permit a person who is chauffeuring a disabled person shall be allowed without need for an identification parking permit momentary parking in the parking space for the purpose of loading or unloading a disabled person and no penalty shall be imposed upon the driver for this momentary parking a person convicted of violating this section shall be punished by a fine of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 all fines collected for this violation shall be distributed as follows fifty 50 percent shall be placed in a separate account of the city to be expended only to improve accessibility and equal opportunity to qualified physically disabled persons in the city and to provide funds to conduct public awareness programs in the city concerning physically disabled persons these funds shall be appropriated by the council prior to expenditure but shall not lapse at the end of any fiscal year and shall remain available for expenditure for the purposes stated herein the remaining percentage of the fines collected shall be distributed as provided by law  31990 article iv  cruising control short title this chapter shall be known and may be referred to as the city of jacksonville beach cruising control ordinance  definitions for the purpose of this chapter the following definitions shall apply congested traffic means traffic on any public street which is delayed to the point that motor vehicles cannot readily move forward on portions of the public street between intersections with other public streets because traffic speed is slowed to less than five miles per hour where the delay in forward movement is due to the position of other motor vehicles cruising means driving a motor vehicle on a designated street past a traffic control point two 2 or more times in any four hour period following a determination that a state of congested traffic exists and during the time in which the city manager the police chief or the designee of either shall have posted a designated street with signs informing the public that the street is subject to regulation under the city of jacksonville beach cruising control ordinance or permitting a motor vehicle to be so operated the operation of a motor vehicle past a traffic control point the second or subsequent time under the aforesaid conditions after notice as provided herein shall constitute unnecessary repetitive driving and therefore a violation of this article designated street means any one 1 or more public streets designated as such pursuant to this article  provided that no portion of a state highway shall be included as a designated street any street so designated shall be clearly marked with signs advising the public that the street is subject to regulation under the city of jacksonville beach cruising control ordinance traffic control point means a clearly identified reference point on a designated street as deter mined and marked from time to time by the police department  cruising prohibited no person shall engage in unnecessary repetitive driving also known as cruising as defined in section 3177 while operating a motor vehicle and no person shall permit another to engage in cruising while operating a motor vehicle under his or her care custody and control after notice as described in section 3179  notice a upon observation that a motor vehicle has been operated on a designated street past a traffic control point two 2 or more times following a determination that a state of congested traffic exists and during the time in which the designated street has been posted as provided herein the vehicle shall be stopped at the time of or after the second or subsequent observation for the purpose of giving notice to the operator and to each passenger in the vehicle the notice which may be given orally or in writing shall inform the operator and passengers that this article is in effect and that a subsequent operation of the vehicle past a traffic control point within four hours after the initial observation of the vehicle shall constitute a violation of this article the notice shall include a brief and general description of the designated streets or the area containing the designated streets and a description of the fine which may be imposed upon conviction b because the operation of a motor vehicle past a traffic control point after issuance of the notice described herein constitutes the offense of violating section 3178 a citation shall be issued to the actual operator of the motor vehicle at the time the offense occurs if the operator was the operator or a passenger in the motor vehicle at the time of the issuance of the notice it shall be immaterial whether the operator at the time the offense occurs actually operated the motor vehicle each time it passed the traffic control point c at the time a motor vehicle is stopped to give the notice described in this section and at the time a motor vehicle is stopped after the giving of such notice and prior to issuing a citation to the operator of the motor vehicle the officer shall afford the operator or a passenger in the motor vehicle an opportunity to explain his or her conduct no person shall be convicted for violating section 3178 if it appears at trial that the explanation given was true and disclosed a lawful purpose and that the lawful purpose did not constitute unnecessary repetitive driving refusal by the person to explain his or her conduct to the officer shall not be deemed an element of the offense or evidence establishing probable cause that the person has violated this section nor shall such refusal be admissible against the person in a trial of the offense  exclusions shall not apply to 1 any public service police fire emergency or other governmental vehicle or any ambulance when operated in official capacity  or 2 any licensed public transportation vehicle or any vehicle utilized for business or commercial purposes when operated for such purposes  designation of streets the city manager the chief of police or the ranking police officer on duty in the police department is authorized to designate a public street other than a state highway as a designated or cruising restricted street upon a determination that a state of congested traffic as defined in section 3177 exists such designation shall include any portion of the street within which the congested traffic condition is found to exist upon the designation of a public street as a designated or cruising restricted street the police department shall post or cause to be posted notices to the public to such effect and shall establish one 1 or more traffic control points to identify the vehicles being operated upon the designated street  penalty any person violating section 3178 shall upon conviction be subject to the imposition of a fine not exceeding five hundred dollars $50000  utilities footnotes  1  cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 7  garbage and refuse ch 13  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 28 article i  in general footnotes  2  editors note  adopted feb 6 201 effective feb 29 201 amended art i in its entirety to read as herein set out former art i  3213212 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  252 254   adopted sept 21 1981   adopted  see the table for complete derivation definitions a the term city as used in this chapter shall mean the city of jacksonville beach or where appropriate the term shall also mean the city manager to include the managers assigned representatives who is responsible for the administration and enforcement of this chapter of the city ordinances b the term delinquent date as used in this chapter shall mean the day following the due date c the term disconnect date termination date as used in this chapter shall mean the service disconnection day d the term due date as used in this chapter shall mean the 21st day after the billing date e the term electric system as used in this chapter shall mean and be deemed to include all poles wires transmission lines fixtures transformers attachments equipment and other facilities owned and used by the city in the production and distribution of electric power and all equipment and property used in connection therewith and all other facilities of any nature or description real or personal now or later owned or used by the city in the production and distribution of electric power by its municipally owned electric system f the term sewer system as used in this chapter shall mean and be deemed to include all conduits and works operated by the city for the collection and conveying of sanitary sewage from the pipe connection at the property line in the street fronting the individual properties to the point of final disposition and all equipment and facilities used in connection therewith including all pipelines manholes trunk lines pumping equipment lift stations purification and treatment facilities and works whatsoever real or personal now or later owned or used by the city in the operation of the sewer system g the term utilities as used in this chapter shall mean those services rendered by the city ie electric natural gas water sewer stormwater solid waste reclaimed water and other services as may be added or modified from time to time by the city h the term utility account as used in this chapter shall mean a numbered record of debit and credit entries to cover transactions pertaining to the billing of utilities i the term water system as used in this chapter shall mean and be deemed to include all wells pumping stations purification plants and other sources of supply of water and all pipes mains and other parts of the facilities for the distribution of water and all equipment and property used in connection therewith and all other facilities of any nature or description real or personal now or later owned or used by the city in the supply and distribution of water by its municipally owned water system  2612 reserved general utility charges and fees schedule of charges and fees general utilities charges and fees shall be established described and adjusted by resolution from time to time and shall include but not be limited to the following 1 late charges and delinquency reconnect charges 2 deposits 3 cutin service charges 4 service charges for tampering with utility service 5 service charges for meter tests  2612 application required for utility service it shall be unlawful for any person to use city utilities without first making written application for service before the service is desired and paying all costs charges fees and deposits incident thereto signed applications shall be made on forms furnished by the city and shall constitute an agreement by the applicant with the city to abide by all provisions of this chapter and the citys applicable rules relating to its utility services rendered as may from time to time be operative and effective applications for utility service shall be accompanied by positive identification ie a valid drivers license applications for service by firms partnerships associations and corporations shall be tendered only by their authorized agents and the official title of the parties shall be signed to the application  2612 withholding or discontinuing service authorized when indebtedness to city not paid the city may withhold or discontinue service rendered under application made by any member or agent of a family household organization or business unless all prior indebtedness to the city of the family household organization or business for service has been paid in full  2612 recovery of delinquent charges the city may recover by due process of law the amount of any unpaid utility service charge including but not limited to all billed charges and amounts collection costs applicable interest charges attorney fees and delinquency fees  2612 payment of charges delinquent accounts late charges and reconnect charges a bills for service will be rendered monthly but the rendering of bills is not an obligation on the part of the city and failure of the consumer to receive the bills shall not release or diminish the consumers obligation to pay any bill or relieve the consumer of any obligation under this chapter b all bills including service charges and taxes are due and payable at the utility billing office when rendered to the consumer  however if payment in full has not been received in the utility billing office by  pm on or before the due date that shall be twentyone 21 days after the bill is rendered then the bill shall be deemed delinquent and all bills incur a late charge immediately upon a bill becoming delinquent the finance officer or his designee shall notify the consumer by written notice that the bill is delinquent and that unless the delinquent bill is paid before the disconnection date on the notice the city shall have the delinquent services discontinued until the bill or bills for all billed services previously rendered to the customer together with any applicable service charges has been paid applicable service charges may be applied for but not be limited to the following services 1 customer request for reconnecting service 2 field collection of bills and service charges for a delinquent account without being disconnected c in order to accommodate customers on social security on disability income or with extraordinary hardship circumstances that are determined to be a reasonable basis for accommodation by the citys authorized representative the due date may be altered d the late charge may be waived not more than once per calendar year when it appears that the customer has made a reasonable effort to deliver the payment in a timely manner that payment was late due to circumstances beyond the control of the customer and customer has established good payment history  2612 deposits required for service in case of all applications for utility services the city shall require payment of all applicable service connection charges and also a deposit in the amount provided below to secure the payment of bills for utility service as they mature the deposit shall be held by the city until final settlement of the users account for utility services furnished by the city and upon final settlement of the users account any unused balance of the deposit will be refunded all deposits shall be evidenced by nontransferable receipts issued by the city in the name of the prospective consumer applying for service after a cash deposit has remained with the city for at least six 6 months it shall then earn simple interest of not more than six 6 percent per annum earned interest shall be paid at the time that the deposit is refunded 1 deposit schedule all deposit amounts are subject to review and adjustment based upon average monthly utility bills when service is changed becomes delinquent or is disconnected for nonpayment a onetime review of deposits will be made upon request after the first six 6 months of service to determine if the deposit amount should be decreased 2 deposit types a residential b commercial general service and general service demand 3 methods of deposit a cash b irrevocable letter of credit c indemnity bond  2612   waiver of residential deposits residential deposits may be waived if the consumer accompanies his application for utility service with a letter of credit in a format approved by the city from a previous utility which states that the customer has received utility service for a minimum of one 1 year and that no charges have been made against the account in the past twelve 12 months for 1 late payments  2 delinquent disconnection  3 dishonored checks  4 meter tampering a residential deposit may be required to be reinstated if at any later date the account payment history contains late payments delinquent disconnections dishonored checks and or meter tampering or if there is a change in service provided or a change of service locations  2612 refund of deposits a residential deposits will be refunded after a minimum of one 1 year of service at the same service address provided that no charges have been made against the account in the past twelve 12 months for 1 late fees  2 delinquent cutoff fees  3 dishonored checks 4 meter tampering b commercial general service and general service demand deposits are not refundable before termination of service  2612 cutin service charges a service charge for the cutin of new transferred or renewed utility service shall be paid in accordance with established charges as set by resolution  2612 basis of billing when meter inoperative if any meter on the users premises is destroyed by fire or other cause or fails to register the user will be billed for the period involved on a basis of previous consumption  2612 tampering with utility service a it shall be unlawful for any person to in any way meddle tamper with or otherwise alter or change the utility system on any premises or to in any way interfere with a meter or meter connection and should it appear that any utility services have been received by meddling or tampering then and in that event the city shall have the right to discontinue the service until the defect is corrected the consumer or property owner may be charged with and billed for the utility service as provided by fs  81214 or as otherwise provided by law b the following charges for the repair or replacement of equipment damaged due to meddling or tampering with a utility service shall be set by resolution and include but are not limited to 1 to remove or lock meter for unauthorized consumption cost to replace damaged equipment and estimated cost of kwh consumption 2 to remove meter or lock for unauthorized consumption cost to replace damaged equipment estimated cost of kwh consumption and disconnection of overhead or underground service cable  2612 testing of meters  payment of costs  special readings upon written notice a meter will be tested by the city and in the event the meter when tested is found to be not more than two 2 percent fast the expense of the test shall be paid by the consumer otherwise the expense of the test will be borne by the city and billing adjustments for a period not to exceed six 6 months will be made  2612 secs 3214 3215  reserved article ii  water and sewer systems footnotes  3  editors note  adopted feb 6 201 effective feb 29 201 amended art ii in its entirety to read as herein set out former art ii  32163235 32413253 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from 43   adopted oct 1 1979   adopted    adopted  see the table for complete derivation cross reference water and sewers in trailer camps  1730  sanitation regulations in trailer camps  1733 division 1  generally designated essential public utilities  compulsory connection required where available a the use of the citys water system and sewer system including improvements replacements extensions or additions as may from time to time be added thereto or incorporated therein are determined and declared to be essential for the protection and preservation of the public health comfort safety economy and general welfare of the inhabitants of the city b the owner tenant or occupant of each lot or parcel of land within the city which abuts a street alley easement or other public way containing a city water or sewer main or which is located within one hundred 100 feet of a city water or sewer main and upon which lot or parcel a building or other inhabitable structure has been or shall be erected for residential commercial or industrial use shall be required to connect the building or structure to the water and sewer systems or to as many of the several and respective systems as may from time to time be extended so as to be or become available within the above distance within three hundred sixtyfive 365 days after notification that the system is available and shall thereafter refrain from using or cease to use any other method for utility services which are now or may later become available  and shall thereafter pay all the charges fees and rates as provided for and set by resolution all connections shall be in accordance with city rules and regulations which shall be established from time to time which may provide for reasonable charges set by resolution c the owner tenant occupant user or consumer shall pay all established water and sewer rates charges and fees for the capacity and use of water from the citys water system and for the capacity and disposal of wastewater to the citys sewer system except as set forth otherwise within this article d in the areas in the city limits outside of the limits or distance as specified in subsection b from the sewer lines and where water is available for flushing no outdoor toilets shall be permitted and every dwelling or other occupied structure shall be provided with a sanitary septic tank e the same rules applicable to the installation of plumbing in the city shall apply to the installation of septic tanks and the same fees for inspection as are provided in this code for plumbing inspection  2612 water meter installation  ownership and cost except for charges specified in the city will install and properly maintain at its own expense meters and piping necessary for meter installation as may be necessary to measure the water service used by the consumer all meters and meter piping and meter box or meter vault installed by or for the city shall remain the citys property it shall be unlawful for anyone to operate any city owned appurtenances on water services the consumer shall properly protect the citys property on the consumers property or on city properties adjacent to consumers property and in the event of any loss or damage to the citys property caused by or arising out of carelessness neglect or misuse by the customer or other unauthorized parties the cost of making good the loss or repairing the damage shall be paid by the consumer or property owner  2612 water service lateral piping and sewer service lateral piping  responsibility a the property owner or consumer is responsible for the water service lateral piping from the premises facilities to the adjacent city rightofway or to the connection with the citys water main whichever is applicable b the property owner or consumer is responsible for the sewer service lateral piping from the premises facilities to the adjacent city rightofway or to the connection with the citys sewer main whichever is applicable c it shall be the property owners or consumers responsibility to ensure that the water service lateral piping and the sewer service lateral piping are compliant with all applicable codes regulations and laws as maybe enacted from time to time  2612 determination of type of water or sewer service a there shall be no free services rendered by the citys water or sewer systems b the city manager or the managers authorized representative shall have the authority to determine what type of water or sewer service shall be rendered by the city in the case of any and all service applications and shall have continuing authority to at all times require charges that may be appropriate to bring each service into conformity with sound municipal practice or as otherwise provided by law c water service for irrigation only or primarily irrigation purposes shall not be established except as set forth otherwise within this article  2612 water and sewer rates charges and fees schedule of rates charges and fees the schedule of rates charges and fees for the water and sewer systems utility shall be established described and adjusted by resolution from time to time and shall include but not be limited to the following 1 water rate charges the water rates for monthly charges for water services and facilities provided by the citys water system are based on water meter measurement water meter size and fire protection service lateral a base water rate the rate shall be applicable to the meter size retail quantities of water are delivered to the consumer and shall be rendered monthly to each consumer in addition to the volume rate the resulting full fixed base water rate charge shall be paid by the consumer whether or not the volume water rate charge may be for a fractional part of month as may be involved in the start or stop of service b volume water rate the rate shall be applicable to all retail quantities of water shown by monthly meter readings or fractional part as may be involved in the start or stop of service to have been delivered to the consumer the resulting volume water rate charge shall be paid by the consumer c fire protection service water rate the rate shall be applicable to all water service laterals water tap provided exclusively for sprinkling systems or other fire protection systems in buildings or on premises and shall be rendered monthly as either a single charge or pro rated equally to the consumers within the buildings or premises the resulting full fixed fire protection service water rate charge shall be paid by the consumers to which it is rendered whether or not the volume water rate charge may be for a fractional part of month as may be involved in the start or stop of service 2 sewer rate charges the sewer rates for monthly charges for sewer services and facilities provided by the citys sewer system are based on water meter measurement and water meter size a base sewer rate the rate shall be applicable to the meter size retail quantities of water are delivered to the consumer and shall be rendered monthly to each consumer in addition to the volume rate the resulting full fixed base sewer rate charge shall be paid by the consumer whether or not the volume sewer rate charge may be for a fractional part of month as may be involved in the start or stop of service b volume sewer rate the rate shall be applicable to all retail quantities of water shown by monthly meter readings or fractional part as may be involved in the start or stop of service to have been delivered to the consumer the resulting volume sewer rate charge shall be paid by the consumer 3 water service charges a water installation charge the charge is based on meter size and shall be paid by the consumer for the city to furnish and install water service lateral from water main to the property line for install events that consist of new lateral change of lateral size or change of a lateral location b water meter charge the charge is based on meter size and shall be paid by the consumer for the city to furnish and install water meter and meter piping and meter box for install events that consist of new meter change of meter size and change of meter location c water capital improvement charge the charge is based on either meter size or type facility for multiple living units and shall be paid by the consumer to the city for install events that consist of new lateral change of lateral size and change of lateral location water capital improvement charges paid to the city shall be deposited and held in a special account designated as the the water and sewer capital improvement account the moneys deposited and held in the account shall be used for the improvements expansion andor replacement of the water sewer and reclaimed systems to include but not limited to the water treatment and wastewater treatment facilities unencumbered monies shall be carried over from year to year in this account 4 sewer service charges a sewer installation charge the charge is based on sewer service lateral size sewer tap and shall be paid by consumer for the city to furnish and install the sewer service lateral from the sewer main to the property line for install events that consist of new lateral change of lateral size or change of lateral location b sewer capital improvement charge the charge is based on either meter size or type facility for multiple living units and shall be paid by the consumer to the city for install events that consist of new lateral change of lateral size and change of lateral location sewer capital improvement charges paid to the city shall be deposited and held in a special account designated as the the water and sewer capital improvement account the moneys deposited and held in this fund shall be used for the improvements expansion andor replacement of the water sewer and reclaimed systems to include but not limited to the water treatment and wastewater treatment facilities unencumbered monies shall be carried over from year to year in this account 5 other charges for water and sewer services a temporary water service charges temporary water service for circuses fairs carnivals jetting construction work and the like shall be rendered upon written application accompanied by the advance payment of the amounts the city may determine sufficient to cover the citys estimated cost of furnishing a suitable meter for measuring and gauging the water furnished requested connection together with materials labor and other expense to be incurred by the city in providing extensions or facilities for rendering service users shall pay the city for all quantities of water shown by monthly or other specified meter readings to have been delivered at the same schedule of rates as set forth in this article upon termination of this service any balance of this deposit shall be refunded to the user b additional burden sewer rate charge the monthly sewer rate charge may be increased but in no event decreased according to rates and charges as may be established and adjusted from time to time as being fair and equitable after investigation to determine whether the quantity character or strength of sewage or industrial waste from any source or premises imposes a burden upon the citys sewer system greater than the burden imposed by the average domestic sewage entering the citys sewer system in which event increased rates or additional charges shall be made in an amount that the city shall deem to be fair and equitable to meet the additional cost of collection treatment and disposal of sewage or industrial waste  and the city may if it deems advisable compel the owner tenant or occupant of the building or premises to treat the sewage or industrial waste in the manner that the city shall specify before discharging the sewage into the citys sewer system c crossconnection control fee all new construction rehabilitation andor remodeling will require crossconnection control devices and the owner or consumer shall pay associated fees as established and described and as adjusted from time to time d other charges or fees that are established and described and as adjusted from time to time by the city related to providing water and sewer services to consumers operating and maintaining the water and sewer systems and to implementing all related regulations and policies 6 water supplied to the city a the cost for the city of taking water from the citys water system fire hydrants for the prevention and extinguishment of fire and for flushing streets and other municipal needs shall be incorporated into the established schedule of rates and charges to be paid by all other consumers b all other water services and all sewer services used by the city for municipal purposes shall be paid for according to the established schedule of applicable rates and charges c the city shall use alternative water supplies for municipal irrigation purposes where practical when not practical and water from the citys water system is used the city shall pay all applicable established water rates and charges d revenues received for water and sewer services furnished to the city shall be deemed to be revenues derived from the operation of the citys water and sewer systems utility and shall be applied and accounted for in the same manner as other revenues derived from the operation of the systems  provided that nothing in this chapter shall be construed as requiring the city to avail itself of the facilities or services afforded by the utility  2612 secs 32213225  reserved users liability for water and sewer service  duration liability for water or sewer service shall respectively begin on the day the user is connected to the citys water or sewer main in accordance with the provisions of this article and shall continue unless disconnected for nonpayment or other cause until a request is given to the city by the user to terminate the service no allowance will be made for vacant houses unless a request to have the water and sewer service shut off is received by the city nor will any allowance be made for any shutoff period less than thirty 30 days  2612 obstructing or leaking water service pipe or sewer service pipe responsibility of keeping clean in good repair and watertight a water service pipe 1 the owner tenant or occupant of the property shall be continuously responsible for maintaining and keeping the water pipe leading to and between the plumbing system of his premises to the citys main water line clean and free from obstruction and shall not cause suffer or permit any article or thing to be introduced into the pipe which causes a stoppage including tuberculation of the pipe failure to keep the water pipe leading from the plumbing system to the water main clean and maintained in proper condition will give the city the right to cut off the water connection which shall not be reconnected until the water pipe is cleaned and maintained properly 2 the owner tenant or occupant of the property shall be continuously responsible for maintaining and keeping the water pipes leading to and between the plumbing system of his premises to the citys main water line in good repair and watertight so as to prevent the loss of water from the water system and to prevent the introduction of any stormwater surface water groundwater roof runoff subsurface drainage uncontaminated cooling water or unpolluted industrial process waters to the water system failure to keep the water pipe leading from the plumbing system to the water main in good repair and watertight will give the city the right to cut off the water connection until the water pipe is repaired and watertight b sewer service pipe 1 the owner tenant or occupant of the property shall be continuously responsible for maintaining and keeping the sewer pipe leading to and between the plumbing system of his premises to the citys main sewer line clean and free from obstruction and shall not cause suffer or permit any article or thing to be introduced into the pipe which causes a stoppage failure to keep the sewer pipe leading from the plumbing system to the sewer main clean and maintained in proper condition will give the city the right to cut off the water connection which shall not be reconnected until the sewer pipe is cleaned and maintained properly 2 the owner tenant or occupant of the property shall be continuously responsible for maintaining and keeping the sewer pipes leading to and between the plumbing system of his premises to the citys main sewer line in good repair and watertight so as to prevent the introduction of any stormwater surface water groundwater roof runoff subsurface drainage uncontaminated cooling water or unpolluted industrial process waters to the sanitary sewer failure to keep the sewer pipe leading from the plumbing system to the sewer main in good repair and watertight will give the city the right to cut off the water connection until the sewer pipe is repaired and watertight c city reserves authority to work on water service lateral piping and sewer service lateral piping in the best interests of the safety and health of the public the city may clean repair maintain andor bring into code compliance water service lateral piping or sewer service lateral piping where these pipes are on city land or rightsofway  2612 leaks a no allowance or adjustment of any volume of water delivered shall be made for leaks of any nature occurring on the consumers side of the meter an allowance or adjustment of a water bill may be made to the extent that any water usage in excess of the normal monthly usage due to a leak on the consumers side of the meter based upon the time of year and prior consumption history may be adjusted to the rate in effect for zero 0 to four 4000 gallons the city shall decide the extent of an allowance or adjustment based upon prior consumption history any request for adjustment must be accompanied by documentation of the leak in a format acceptable to the city b also an allowance or adjustment of a volume billed for excess sewer may be made if the water service was broken at a point where the discharge did not enter the sanitary sewer system the city shall decide the extent of an allowance or adjustment based upon prior consumption history any request for adjustment must be accompanied by documentation of the leak in a format acceptable to the city no allowances shall be made for running water due to weather conditions c a onetime allowance or adjustment of volume billed for sewer usage may be made to fill swimming pools when newly constructed or when drained for repairs and refilled  2612 right of access to consumers premises the applicant shall grant or cause to be granted to the city without cost all rights easements permits and privileges which are necessary for the rendering of water or sewer service authorized city employees with proper identification shall have access at all reasonable hours to the premises of the applicant for the purposes including but not limited to reading meters installing or removing any of its property examining pipes or fixtures or for any purpose incidental to the rendering of water and sewer service  2612 tapping water and sewer mains etc by authorized persons only no person except those persons employed or authorized by the city shall tap the citys water or sewer mains or make any other connection to pipes on the supply side of any meter  2612 unauthorized connections no person shall connect to or turn on any water or sewer service or cut in interconnect tap or make any alteration to any main or distribution or collection pipe of the citys water or sewer system or in any way interfere with or molest any of the walls reservoirs basins or water in the same or permit any connection or tapping to be made to the citys water or sewer system on his premises or the premises occupied by him or to knowingly use city water or sewer service from connections in violation of any of the provisions of this article or any rules or regulations adopted by the city council with respect thereto  2612 connections to be approved by plumbing inspector no water or sewer service shall be connected until the plumbing and connections incident thereto shall have been inspected and approved by the city plumbing inspector  2612 citys liability for damages the city shall not be liable for any damage resulting from consumption use or exposure to wastewater andor its possible ancillary bacteriological agents bursting of any water or sewer main service pipe or cock or by shutting off the water or by discontinuing the operation of its sewage collection treatment and disposal facilities for repairs extensions or connections or from the accidental failure of the water supply or sewage collection treatment and disposal system from any cause whatsoever in cases of emergency the city shall have the right to restrict the use of water or its sewage collection treatment and disposal system in any reasonable manner for the protection of the city and its water or sewage systems  2612 defining and regulating crossconnections and backflow prevention device assemblies and providing for corrections a crossconnection means any physical arrangement whereby a public water supply is connected directly or indirectly with any other water supply system sewer drain lawn sprinklers conduit pool storage reservoir plumbing fixtures appliances or other devices which contain or may contain contaminated water sewage or other waste or liquid of unknown or unsafe quality which may be capable of imparting contamination to the public water supply as the result of backflow bypass arrangements connections removable sections swivel or changeable devices and other temporary or permanent devices or because of which backflow could occur are considered to be crossconnections all primary potable use commercial water services require an approved reduced pressure device assembly all secondary commercial water services fire suppression irrigation etc require an approved backflow prevention device the type of device assembly required for each secondary service is dictated by the services degree of hazard as determined in the most current edition of the manual of crossconnection control published by the foundation for crossconnection control and hydraulic research at the university of southern california b no consumer of water from the city water system shall have a crossconnection or potential crossconnection either inside or outside of any building or buildings without an approved backflow prevention device being installed to prevent any and all backflow all backflow prevention device assemblies are required to be kept in good working order and be fieldtestable all backflow prevention device assemblies shall as a minimum be tested annually by a certified tester approved by the city the ownerconsumer is responsible for the testing and all maintenance and the costs c only the following are considered to be fieldtestable backflow prevention device assemblies and shall be installed in agreement with and under supervision of the director of public works or hisher designated representative 1 air gap separation is a physical separation between the free flowing discharge end of a potable water supply pipeline and an open or nonpressure receiving vessel this gap must be at least double the diameter of the supply pipe measured vertically above the rim of the vessel and in no case less than one inch 2 reduced pressure device assembly is a device containing within its structure a minimum of two 2 independently acting approved check valves with an automatically operating pressure differential relief valve located between the two 2 check valves that will discharge to the atmosphere if the check valves should fail this unit shall include tightly closing shutoff valves located at each end of the device and each device shall be fitted with properly located test cocks 3 atmospheric vacuum breaker is a device operated by atmospheric pressure in combination with the force of gravity the unit is designed to work on a vertical plane only the one moving part consists of a poppet valve which must be carefully sized to the slide in a guided chamber and effectively shut off the reverse flow of water when there is a negative pressure 4 pressure vacuum breaker is a device similar to an atmospheric vacuum breaker except that the checking unit poppet valve is activated by a spring and does not require a negative pressure to react 5 double check valve device assembly is an assembly composed of two 2 single independently acting drip tight check valves including tightly closing shutoff valves at each end and suitable connections for testing the water tightness of each check valve d the city or its representatives with proper identification may enter at any time inside or outside of any building or buildings for the purpose of checking for crossconnections if a crossconnection or potential crossconnection is found the city shall have the right to discontinue water services until the problem has been corrected by elimination or until a proper backflow prevention device has been installed all backflow prevention devices are subject to periodic inspection by a city representative at city discretion to insure proper operation e these provisions relative to crossconnection have been established for the protection of all the inhabitants of the city and to comply with florida administrative as otherwise provided by law f all water services plumbing fixtures and crossconnection control methods shall conform to the crossconnection control standards and procedures as approved by the department of public works  2612 regulation of landscape irrigation for water conservation a
