residential living facilities shall be considered residential service and is exempted from the kwh and kw limitations and individual metered requirement contained within this definition however electrical service for federally assisted rental housing and qualified 501c3 organizations shall not be considered residential service if the meter also supplies electric energy for nonresidential users such as administrative offices nursing facilities or utility facilities service shall mean in addition to all electrical energy required by the consumer the maintenance by the city at the point of delivery of approximately the agreed voltage and frequency and shall constitute the rendering of service irrespective of whether consumer makes any use thereof service laterals shall mean the wires of the city which are connected to the service leads of the consumer service leads shall mean that portion of the consumers installation to which the city connects its service wires    31681   121685 shall not be liable to the customer for complete or partial failure or interruption of service or for fluctuations in voltage resulting from causes beyond its control or ordinary negligence of its employees servants or agents nor shall the utility be liable for the direct or indirect consequences of interruptions or curtailments made in accordance with the provisions of its rate schedule for interruptible curtailable and load management service the utility shall not be liable for any act or omission caused directly or indirectly by strikes labor troubles accidents litigation shutdowns or kilowatt hours purchased for resale by the electric utility system from the florida municipal power agency during the twelvemonth period ending on june 30 of the prior fiscal year the maximum millage rate effective for fiscal years beginning  or thereafter is set at five dollars and fifty cents $550 per one thousand 1000 kilowatt hours purchased  3413 secs 32783290  reserved article iv  stormwater utility system footnotes  4  editors note  adopted sept 17 199 did not specifically amend the   hence inclusion herein as art iv  329132100 was at the discretion of the editor pertaining to ordinance components conflicts and an effective date have been omitted from codification authority the city is authorized by the florida constitution and the provisions of fs ch 125 and fsa   to construct reconstruct improve and extend stormwater utility systems and to issue revenue bonds and other debts if needed to finance in whole or part the cost of such system and to establish just and equitable rates fees and charges for the services and facilities provided by the system  91790 findings and determinations it is hereby found determined and declared as follows 1 those elements of the system which provide for the collection of and disposal of stormwater and regulation of groundwater are of benefit and provide services to all property within the incorporated city limits including property not presently served by the storm elements of the system 2 the cost of operating and maintaining the city stormwater management system and financing necessary repairs replacements improvements and extension thereof should to the extent practicable be allocated in relationship to the benefits enjoyed and services received therefrom  91790 definitions for the purpose of this article the following definitions shall apply  words used in the singular shall include the plural and the plural the singular  words used in the present tense shall include the future tense the word shall is mandatory and not discretionary the word may is permissive words not defined herein shall be construed to have the meaning given by common and ordinary use as defined in the latest edition of websters dictionary city manager means the city manager of the city of jacksonville beach developed property means that which has been altered from its natural state by the addition of any improvements such as a building structure impervious surface change of grade or landscaping director of public works means the director of public works of the city of jacksonville beach dwelling unit means any residential space identified for habitation by members of the same family or as classified by the city building code equivalent residential unit eru means the statistical average horizontal impervious area of residential units singlefamily mobile homes multifamily condominiums etc within the city the horizontal impervious area includes but is not limited to all areas covered by structures roof extensions patios porches driveways and sidewalks impervious area or impervious surface means a horizontal surface which has been compacted or covered with a layer of material so that it is highly resistant to infiltration by water it includes but is not limited to semipervious surfaces such as compacted clay as well as streets roofs sidewalks parking lots and other similar surfaces nonresidential property means any lot or parcel not exclusively residential as defined herein including transient rentals such as hotels and motels for new construction a property shall be considered developed pursuant to this article 1 upon issuance of a certificate of occupancy or upon completion of construction of final inspection if no such certificate is issued  or 2 where construction is at least fifty 50 percent complete and construction is halted for a period of three 3 months residential property means any lot or parcel developed exclusively for residential purposes including but not limited to singlefamily homes manufactured homes multifamily apartment buildings and condominiums  91790 stormwater management utility fee a stormwater fee is hereby imposed upon each developed lot and parcel within the city for services and facilities provided by stormwater management system for purposes of imposing the stormwater fee all lots and parcels within the city are classified into the following two 2 customer classes 1 residential singlefamily mobile home multifamily condominiums 2 nonresidential governmental institutional tax exempt commercial industrial other  91790 schedule of rates the director of public works is directed to prepare a list of lots and parcels within the incorporated city limits and assign a classification of residential or nonresidential to each lot or parcel 1 the city council upon recommendation of the director of public works shall by resolution establish the average square footage of impervious area of the eru and shall by resolution establish reasonable rates for stormwater management systems for each eru 2 the fee imposed for residential properties shall be the rate for one 1 eru multiplied by the number of individual dwelling units existing on the property eru  no of dwelling units 3 the fee imposed for nonresidential properties as defined shall be the rate for one 1 eru multiplied by the numerical factor obtained by dividing the total impervious area of a nonresidential property by the eru  impervious area  eru 4 the director of public works shall be responsible for determining the impervious area based on data supplied by the county property appraiser or by the property owner tenant or developer if such information is unavailable the director of public works may require additional information as necessary to make the determination the billing amount shall be updated by the director of public works based on any additions to the impervious area as approved building permit process 5 the minimum fee for any nonresidential parcel shall be equal to the rate for one 1 eru 6 all unoccupied developed lots and parcels shall be subject to the stormwater management utility fee  91790 billing and payment the stormwater utility fee is to be paid as billed by the owner tenant or occupant of each lot or parcel which is subject to the stormwater fee persons using the services and facilities of the stormwater management system shall be rendered bills or statements for the use of these services and facilities of said system from the city which said bills or statements shall be due and payable as set forth on the bill or statement  91790 adjustment of fees a requests for adjustment of the stormwater utility fee shall be submitted director of public works who shall be given authority to administer the procedures and standards and review criteria for the adjustment of fees as established herein all requests shall be judged on the basis of the amount of impervious area on the site no credit shall be given for the installation of facilities required by city or county development codes or state stormwater rules the following procedures shall apply to all adjustment requests of the stormwater utility fee 1 any owner who has paid his stormwater utility fees and who believes the contribution rate component of his stormwater utility fee to be incorrect may subject to the limitations set forth in this article submit an adjustment request to the director of public works 2 adjustment requests for stormwater utility fees paid by an owner making the request shall be in writing and set forth in detail the grounds upon which relief is sought 3 adjustment requests made during the first calendar year that the stormwater utility fee is imposed will be reviewed by the director of public works within a four 4 month period from the date of filing of the adjustment request adjustments resulting from such request shall be retroactive to the beginning of billings but shall not exceed one 1 year 4 the owner requesting the adjustment may be required at his own cost to provide supplemental information to the director of public works including but not limited to survey data approved by either a registered professional land surveyor rpls and engineering reports approved by a professional engineer pe failure to provide such information may result in the denial of the adjustment request 5 adjustments to the stormwater utility fee will be made upon the granting of the adjustment request in writing by the director of public works denials of adjustment requests shall be made in writing by the director of public works b upon receipt of the written denial of the adjustment request the owner who initially requested the adjustment may within thirty 30 days of receipt of such denial apply to the city manager for review of the denial 1 the city manager shall complete his review within sixty 60 days of receipt of said request for review the city managers determination on the review shall be in writing and set forth in detail the denial the reasons for his decision 2 in reviewing denials of adjustment requests the city manager shall apply the standards and review criteria contained in this section 3 all determinations of the city manager arising out of this section will be final  91790 capital contributions procedures and standards developed by the director of public works shall define appropriate means by which to optimize development capital contributions in the implementation of basin specific stormwater systems these basin specific capital contributions shall take the form of the feeinlieuof availability charges each situation will be analyzed by the director of public works and a specific written decision will be developed the application of each is defined as follows 1 feeinlieuof is applied to a site specific negotiated procedure where in a developments stormwater contribution quantity and quality is assessed its share of the capital needs of the facilities required to serve the development in question this capital contribution would be used to implement cityowned stormwater facilities the process does not apply wherein the stormwater facilities are privately held each application is evaluated against the citys master plan for the watershed involved or while the master plan is incomplete the cumulative impacts from the development will be evaluated 2 availability charge is administered on a site specific basis identical to the feeinlieuof procedure noted above  the only difference is that the capital investment advanced by the city in implementing a stormwater facility is now recovered availability charge the capital charge is determined on a prorata share of the capacity used by the new applicant or by the cumulative impact from the development upon all impacted facilities  91790 program responsibility it shall be the duty of the director of public works to administer the stormwater utility program the director of public works shall keep an accurate record of all persons using the services and facilities of said stormwater management system of the city and to make changes in accordance with the rates and charges established in this article  91790 stormwater utility trust funds there shall be established a stormwater utility trust fund for the deposit of all fees and charges collected by the stormwater utility these funds shall be for the exclusive use of the citys stormwater management system including but not limited to the following 1 operation and maintenance of the system 2 funding of pollution abatement devices constructed on stormwater systems discharging to the surface water of the county 3 administrative costs associated with the management of the stormwater utility 4 debt service financing 5 planning and engineering  91790 secs 3210132105  reserved regulation and compliance a purpose and intent the purpose of regulation and compliance is to reduce deposits and discharge of contaminants and pollutants into the stormwater system its appurtenances and its receiving waters  the atlantic ocean and intracoastal estuarial system this results in the protection of the public health and the environment improvement in the management and treatment of stormwater and achievement of regulatory compliance b abbreviations 1 fdep florida department of environmental protection 2 sjrwmd st johns river water management district 3 usdep united states department of environmental protection 4 npdes national pollution discharge elimination system  and 5 fcwa federal clean water act c prohibited deposits and discharges it shall be unlawful for any person or facility to deposit any solids or discharge any liquid or gas that is not identified as acceptable stormwater runoff or an identified allowable deposit or discharge such prohibited deposits and discharges are determined to be contaminants and or pollutants 1 solids solids are defined as materials and particulates suspended in or capable of being deposited in and or transported by stormwater the allowable limits of solids occurring in stormwater are as found in the citys most recent stormwater npdes permit 2 erosion controlconstruction sites no property owner shall allow or neglect uncontrolled earthen exposure to deposit soil and related debris into any stormwater system all construction firms and contractors must follow all fdep and sjrwmd procedures and regulations as they pertain to construction site runoff control 3 littertrashgarbage no person or facility may deposit any litter trash or garbage in any manner that will result in the material being transported by or obstructing a stormwater system all such materials must be containerized in a manner approved by the department of public works 4 lawn waste all materials related to lawn and landscape maintenance having a total surface area of seven hundred 700 square centimeters one hundred eight and onehalf 1085 square inches or less or capable of being transported by or obstructing a stormwater system must be controlled by the use of container and cover or plastic bag approved for leaflawn trash having a unit volume not in excess of one hundred seventysix 176 liters forty 40 gallons 5 sewage solidsanimal feces  no person or facility may deposit sewage solids into a stormwater system any event must be documented and reported in accordance with all npdes permit requirements all animal feces must be controlled and not allowed to decay and or contaminate a stormwater system animal feces must be disposed of in an appropriate manner 6 liquids and gases  defined as viscose flowable matter and solutions liquids and vaporous elements or compounds gases capable of being discharged to and or transported by a stormwater system the allowable limits of liquids and gases occurring in stormwater are as found in the citys most recent stormwater npdes permit 7 volatilesorganic solutions  no person or facility shall allow or neglect the discharge of any volatile or organic solids liquids or gas examples  benzene motor oil antifreeze soaps chlorine grease into a stormwater system 8 pesticidesherbicidesfertilizers  solutions and compounds whose design is to eliminate vermin and pestilence control noxious and undesirable plants and enhance the growth of desirable plants shall be applied at minimum effective levels and in a manner eliminating discharge into a stormwater system 9 sewage liquids  no person or facility may discharge sewage liquids into a stormwater system any event must be documented and reported in accordance with all npdes permit requirements d allowable deposits and discharges  certain solids fluids and gases from line flushing landscape and lawn irrigation uncontaminated ground water infiltration uncontaminated pumped ground water dechlorinated potable water air condition condensate individual residential car washing flows from riparian habitats and wetlands dechlorinated swimming pool water street cleaner water and fire fighting activities may be discharged to the stormwater system the afore listed deposits and discharges may occur only when the receiving system is suitably protected protection may include but is not limited to silt screens hay bales and other approved erosion control decontamination and or desiltation methods e inspection sampling compliance correction and penalties  the city reserves the right to perform inspections for regulatory compliance sampling and analysis may be conducted to determine compliance 1 inspections an authorized representative of the city with or without notice upon proper identification may enter and inspect all properties sites and facilities for activities as they relate to proper stormwater management and compliance with this section and any related statutes and permits all records of pond and lake treatment and equipmentinfrastructure maintenance will be made available at the time of the inspection inspection procedures are not limited to but may include photographing and or video taping infrastructure and activities 2 sampling an authorized representative of the city may remove for the purpose of compliance verification such quantities of solids fluids and gases as are necessary for evidentiary procedures and analysis 3 compliance correction upon verbal or written notice the owner of the property site or facility shall correct any compliance violation correction shall be at a time interval to be determined by the city and based on the degree of hazard caused by the violation 4 penalties upon the determination of violation all fines and penalties are applicable which are currently associated with noncompliance under section 111 of the ordinances of the city of jacksonville beach f permits and fees  the city reserves the right to establish the methodology for permitting stormwater related activities and establishing certain fees 1 the department of public works may upon determination of need establish policies and procedures for permitting and monitoring connection to as well as deposits and discharges to the stormwater system 2 fees may be charged for direct or indirect connection to the stormwater system as well as deposits and or discharges that may be determined by the city to be unusual or excessive these fees shall be effective upon resolution by the city council and are in addition to those fees already established under this chapter and article  111802 secs 3210732138  reserved article v  natural gas definitions the following words and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section unless the context clearly indicates otherwise general service service to a customer supplied on a firm basis for any purpose house piping all piping and fittings installed beyond the meter andor regulator setting mains pipes installed to transport natural gas within a service area to points of connection with the service lines meter andor regulator setting all piping and fittings installed on the outlet side of meter andor regulator setting service line all piping between the main tap up to and including the first valve or fitting of the meter andor regulator setting standard delivery pressure the standard delivery pressure shall be seven 7 inches of water column 36 psig no adjustment will be made for variations from the normal atmospheric pressure at the customers meter gas delivered at the standard delivery pressure may vary from three 3 inches to fifteen 15 inches of water column technical terms 1 atmospheric pressure 1473 pounds per square inch absolute plus gauge irrespective of the actual elevation or location of the point of measurement above sea level or variations in actual atmospheric pressure from time to time 2 british thermal unit btu the quantity of heat required to raise the temperature of one pound avoirdupois of pure water from fiftynine 59 degrees fahrenheit to sixty 60 degrees fahrenheit at a constant pressure of 1473 pounds per square inch absolute 3 btu factor the heat within natural gas a factor to provide an adjustment to account for the heat content of the delivered natural gas that is determined by the supplier and is a measurement of gas quality the factor is printed on the customers bill each month 4 cubic foot of gas for purposes of measurement when natural gas is metered the volume of natural gas which at a temperature of sixty 60 degrees fahrenheit and at an absolute pressure of 1498 pounds per square inch occupies one cubic foot 5 therm one hundred thousand 100000 british thermal units total heating value the number of british thermal units per cubic foot of natural gas for the purposes of determining the number of therms delivered to the customer the city will utilize the average heating value reported by the transporter or supplier of the natural gas received from the transporter or supplier  5310 editors note  adopted  enacted provisions intended for use as  32120 to preserve the style of this to facilitate indexing said provisions have been redesignated as  32139 natural gas rates and charges schedule of charges the schedule of rates and charges for natural gas shall be established by resolution  5310 editors note  adopted  enacted provisions intended for use as  32125 to preserve the style of this to facilitate indexing said provisions have been redesignated as  32140 general a the installation of gas pipes fixtures appliances and other equipment and appurtenances shall be installed in accordance with applicable florida building codes and fire prevention codes b where governmental inspection of an installation is required the city will not supply gas service to such installation until the necessary inspections have been made and city has been authorized to provide gas service the city may also inspect the installation prior to rendering gas service and from time to time thereafter but assumes no responsibility whatsoever as a result of having made such inspection the city shall not render gas service to any customer who fails to meet applicable codes ordinances regulation or statutes c the city will discontinue gas service to a customers appliance whenever it finds a hazardous condition or a condition that is in violation of a code ordinance regulation or statute governing the installation or use of a gas appliance gas service will be rendered or restored only when the hazardous condition or noncompliance has been corrected d customer shall notify the city of any change in customers requirements for gas service and receive authorization from the city prior to making any such change so that the city may meet the customers requirements a customer will be liable for any damage resulting from a violation of this provision e customer shall grant to city without cost to city all rights easements permits and privileges which in citys opinion are necessary for the rendering of gas service customer will furnish to city without charge an acceptable location for citys meter f customer shall properly protect citys property on customers premises and shall permit no one but city employees or agents or persons authorized by law to have access to citys piping meters or apparatus in the event of any loss or damage to the citys property caused by or arising out of carelessness or misuse thereof by customer the customer shall pay city the cost of replacing such loss or repairing such damage g customer shall give city employees and representatives access to customers property so that the city may operate inspect and maintain its facilities on customers premises h no customer or other person shall unless authorized by the city to do so operate change or tamper with any of the citys facilities i where evidence is found that city facilities or service lines meters or other appurtenances on the customers premises have been tampered with the customer shall be required to bear all costs incurred by the city for investigations and inspections and for such protective equipment as in the judgment of the city may be necessary in addition where the tampering has resulted in improper measurement of the service supplied the customer shall be required to pay for such natural gas service including interest at the latepayment charge rate as the city may estimate from available information to have been used but not registered by the city meters j the city shall not be liable for damage to customer equipment or injuries sustained by customer or others due to the condition or character of the customer facilities or equipment the city is not responsible for use care or handling of the gas delivered to the customer beyond the outlet of the meter k the customer shall indemnify hold harmless and defend the city from and against any and all liability proceedings suits cost or expense for loss damage or injury to person or property in any manner directly or indirectly connected with the distribution andor use of gas by the customer at or on the customers side of the point of delivery  5310 permit see section 720 of this provisions regarding gas permits and associated fees  5310 tapping and connection tapping of all gas mains and service connections shall be done by the city or an authorized contractor for the city title to all service connections from the main to the meters and meter installations is vested in the city and the same shall at all times be the sole property of the city and shall not be trespassed upon or interfered with in any respect such city property shall be maintained by the city and may be removed or changed by it at any time  5310 maintenance of meters and service lines the city shall have the right to meter any and all gas service lines the city alone shall have the right to stipulate the size type make and location of meters and type of meter setting all meters shall be maintained by the city the customer shall be held responsible for damage to a meter or service line when such damage results from the negligence of the customer when such damage occurs the city will furnish and set another meter and repair the damaged meter or make other necessary repairs the cost of such repairs including replacement parts labor and transportation charges shall be paid by the customer  5310 meterslocations each gas meter and service regulator shall be installed in a location readily accessible for reading inspection repairs testing and changing of the meter and operation of the gas shutoff valve and shall be protected from corrosion and other damage  5310 status of gas quantity recorded the quantity of gas recorded by the meter shall be conclusive except when the meter is found to be registering inaccurately or has ceased to register in such cases the quantity may be determined by the average registration of the meter in a corresponding past period or by the average registration of the new meter whichever method is in the opinion of the city representative of the conditions existing during the period in question  5310 tampering with meter no person other than an agent of the city shall remove inspect or alter the gas meter or any other part of the gas system located on the premises the customer shall notify the city of any damage to or any failure of the meter or service line  5310 authority to turn on gas 1 generally it shall be unlawful for any person other than an agent of the city to turn on or in any way alter or damage any gas meter which has been turned off by the city the customer serviced by the meter shall be held responsible for any actions 2 unauthorized connections a fee shall be charged for the removal of any device which has been installed in lieu of or in addition to a gas meter except where the pipe or device has been authorized in writing by the city 3 open meter bypass servicing a fee over and above the bill established from the meter reading shall be charged for the service of turning off the meter bypass valve when such opening was not previously authorized in writing by the city 4 broken stop locks a replacement fee shall be charged for the replacement of meter stop locks which have been broken or removed  5310 liability for gas in service lines the city is responsible for the gas in the service lines the term service line means a distribution line that transports gas from a common source of supply to a customer meter a customer meter is the meter that measures the transfer of gas from the city to a customer  5310 pressure the city shall make reasonable efforts to maintain its standard delivery pressure at the point of delivery where delivery pressure higher than standard delivery pressure is supplied the city will make reasonable effort to maintain that delivery pressure prospective industrial and large commercial customers who desire to utilize gas at pressures higher than the standard delivery pressure should inquire of the city to determine the pressure that the city can make available at any given location in its service territory before obtaining any equipment requiring pressures higher than the standard delivery pressure  5310 continuity of service the city shall use reasonable efforts to provide regular uninterrupted gas service but if the service is suspended curtailed or discontinued by the city for any reason or should the service be interrupted curtailed deficient defective or fail by any reason of any act of god accident strike legal process government interference or other causes whatsoever beyond its control the city shall not be liable for any loss damage direct or consequential resulting from any such suspension discontinuance defect interruption curtailment deficiency or failure  5310 limitations of service the city reserves the right to place limitations on the amount and character of service it will supply to refuse service to new customers or existing customers for additional load if unable to obtain sufficient supply for such services  to reject applications for service for additional service where such service is not available or where such service might affect the supply of gas to other customers  or for other good and sufficient reasons  5310 main extensions and service extensions a gas main extensions installations improvement or modifications the city will supply gas service to any prospective customer within the service territory limits of beaches energy services that is adjacent to a city gas main subject to the following condition should a gas main extension installation improvement or modification of facilities be required either onsite or offsite the customer may be required to pay the cost of such facilities b extension of service lines and gas mains not adjacent to existing city gas mains or service lines the city is not required to extend gas mains or service lines that are not adjacent to existing gas mains and service lines however if in the opinion of the city manager or hisher designee the immediate or potential revenues justify the cost of extending the existing gas mains and service lines and the new facilities meet the objectives of the implementation plan for the natural gas utility the city may extend the gas mains and service lines which may be subject to a contractual period of gas service by the customer all extensions shall be of the size and type prescribed by the city manager or hisher designee the city may require a contribution in aid of construction from the customer if the immediate or potential revenues do not totally justify the cost of the facilities as determined by the city manager or hisher designee if a customer fails to meet the contractual service period any cost or portion of the cost of the extension waived by the city shall be billed to the customer c installation of service lines and connections upon application for connection between a natural gas main and a building to be supplied with natural gas the entire installation of the natural gas service line and connections from the main to the meter shall be made by the city unless approved by the beaches energy services director no service line shall be used to supply more than one meter location nor shall any service line be installed across private property other than the premises of the building to be supplied with natural gas until customer provides an easement when in the opinion of the beaches energy services director an existing service line is insufficient to supply new demands put upon it the city will enlarge the facilities as necessary and the installation cost will be borne by the customer when it is necessary to establish a special service connection or a service connection for temporary or parttime use the cost of the entire connection and removal of same less the salvage value of the returned material may be charged to the customer requesting same  5310 transfers to the general fund a that the city manager in preparing his annual budget proposal for submission to the council will calculate the contribution from the natural gas fund to the general fund by multiplying a per therm rate by the number of therms sold in the prior fiscal year by the natural gas utility system b the maximum per therm rate referred to in subsection a is set at five and onehalf 55 cents per therm  111813 secs 3215532159  reserved article vi  reclaimed water system purpose and intent a purpose this article establishes a reclaimed water system utility for the city and provides for regulation of 1 the reclamation of treated wastewater and stormwater 2 the distribution and reuse of waters b intent the intent of this article is to 1 reduce the use of the citys water system supply for nonpotable purposes 2 insure the quality of waters being distributed 3 reserve all rights of ownership and sole franchise for the city  2612 eff 22912 definitions reserved  2612 eff 22912 abbreviations a city means city of jacksonville beach b fcwa means federal clean water act c fdep means florida department of environmental protection d fsdwa means the federal safe drinking water act e sjrwmd means st johns river water management district f epa means united states environmental protection agency  2612 eff 22912 reclaimed water rates charges and fees a schedule of rates charges and fees the schedule of rates charges and fees for the reclaimed water system utility to be paid by consumers shall be described established and adjusted by resolution from time to time b reclaimed water the cost for the city of taking water from the citys reclaimed water system for municipal and other city nonpotable uses shall be incorporated into the established schedule of rates charges and fees for the water sewer and reclaimed systems paid by all other consumers  2612 eff 22912 source waters and their distribution all reclaimed water shall be from systems owned and operated by the city except as set forth otherwise below the distribution and reuse of reclaimed water is to be from a system constructed by or under the direction of the city 1 reservations the city reserves sole authority to a permit property owner or user to connect to the citys reclaimed water system upon submission by owner or user of permit and account application requests b charge and require payment from the user consumer tenant occupant or owner of a premises or property that is connected to the citys reclaimed water system for all reclaimed water rates charges and fees as described and established by resolution 2 onsite distribution system any consumer or property owner whose stormwater drainage system discharges to the citys stormwater collection system may construct an onsite distribution system for the purpose of irrigation with its own stormwater as its source water this is subject to proper permitting before and proper inspection during construction this system shall be independent of any and all potable water systems and shall not cross connect with citys drinking water system or reclaimed water system 3 crossconnection control all consumers of any type of reclaimed water usage shall comply with the citys regulations policies and procedures concerning crossconnection control  2612 eff 22912 policies procedures permits the city reserves the authority to establish methodology for permitting activities related to reclaimed water the city manager or the managers authorized representative shall have the authority to 1 determine what type of reclaimed water service shall be rendered by the city in the case of any and all applications and shall have continuing authority at all times to require charges therein as may be appropriate to bring each service into conformity with sound municipal practice 2 establish policies and procedures for permitting and monitoring connection to the reclaimed water system and charging consumers for provision of the reclaimed water supply system and service  2612 eff 22912 right of access to consumers premises the applicant shall grant or cause to be granted to the city without cost all rights easements permits and privileges which are necessary for the rendering of reclaimed water service authorized city employees with proper identification shall have access at all reasonable hours to the premises of the applicant for all applicable purposes which include but are not limited to installing or removing any of its property examining pipes or fixtures or for any purpose incidental to the rendering of reclaimed water service observing whether the use of reclaimed water adheres to the seasonal irrigation schedule etc  2612 eff 22912 tapping reclaimed water mains etc by authorized persons only no person except those persons employed or authorized by the city for the purpose shall tap the citys reclaimed water mains or make any other connection to city reclaimed water pipes and particularly on city property or easements  2612 eff 22912 unauthorized connections no person shall connect to or turn on any reclaimed water service or cut in interconnect tap or make any alteration to any main or distribution or collection pipe of the citys reclaimed water system or in any way interfere with or molest any of the walls reservoirs basins or water in the same or permit any connection or tapping to be made to the citys reclaimed water system on his premises or the premises occupied by him or to knowingly use city reclaimed water service from connections in violation of any of the provisions of this article or any rules or regulations established by the city with respect thereto  2612 eff 22912 connections to be approved by plumbing inspector no reclaimed water or service shall be connected until the plumbing and connections incident thereto shall have been inspected and approved by the city plumbing inspector  2612 eff 22912 citys liability for damages the city shall not be liable for any damage resulting from consumption use or exposure to reclaimed water andor its possible ancillary bacteriological agents bursting of any reclaimed water main service pipe or cock or by shutting off the reclaimed water or by discontinuing the operation of its reclaimed water treatment supply distribution and disposal facilities for repairs extensions or connections or from the accidental failure of the reclaimed water supply treatment and distribution and disposal systems from any cause whatsoever in cases of emergency the city shall have the right to restrict the use of reclaimed water treatment supply distribution and disposal systems in any reasonable manner for the protection of the city and its reclaimed water system  2612 eff 22912 inspection compliance correction and penalties the city manager or the managers designated representative is authorized to enforce the provisions of this regulation 1 inspections an authorized city representative with or without notice upon proper identification may enter and inspect all properties sites and facilities for activities as they relate to proper usage of reclaimed water and compliance with this regulation inspection procedures are not limited to but may include photographing and or video taping infrastructure and activities 2 compliance correction upon verbal or written notice the resident user andor the owner of the property site or facility shall correct any compliance violation correction shall be at a time interval to be determined by the city 3 penalties upon the determination of violation of this regulation all fines and penalties are applicable which are provided in of administration of this  2612 eff 22912 vehicles for hire footnotes  1  cross reference schedule of taxes and regulations  1513  registration of taxicab drivers required  241  traffic and motor vehicles ch 31 article i  in general secs 3313315  reserved article ii  vehicles for hire footnotes  2  editors note  adopted  repealed the former art ii  33163331 33363343 33503367 and enacted a new art ii  33163323 33503357 3365 3366 as set out herein the former art ii pertained to public vehicles and derived from  adopted sept 7 1977   2 adopted dec 5 1977   adopted    adopted  division 1  generally definitions for the purpose of this chapter the following terms shall respectively be deemed to mean applicant includes every company or business proprietor who makes application to the city for a local business tax receipt to operate a vehicle for hire driver includes every individual operating a vehicle for hire either as owner agent employee or otherwise pursuant to a local business tax receipt issued as herein provided vehicle for hire shall mean all motorized vehicles defined and classified in section 3317 street shall mean and include all public streets avenues boulevards ocean beach alleys lanes highways sidewalks public parks parking roads and other public places laid out for the use of vehicles taximeter shall mean a mechanical or electronic device which calculates and displays a predetermined rate and indicates the charge for hire of a taxicab and which also records and indicates a fare rate or charge based on waiting time extra passengers initial charge and other fares rates or charges transport shall mean to operate or cruise over the streets of the city and its adjacent territory for the purpose of moving passengers or goods from one point to another  8706 classification of vehicles for hire for the purpose of construing and applying the terms of this chapter all motorized vehicles which operate over and upon the streets and driveways of the city for the transportation of persons for compensation shall be classified and defined as follows 1 bus any bus omnibus or other vehicle designed and constructed to comfortably transport seven 7 or more persons which is not used for regularly conducted amusement rides or sightseeing tours and is not operated by another governmental agency 2 cruising car any vehicle for hire based upon a preestablished schedule of flat charges rather than by taximeter calculation with an open touring or sedan body designed and constructed to comfortably transport not more than six 6 persons including the driver 3 limousine a vehicle for hire only by prearrangement at a rate charged per hour or fixed in advance and is a chauffeured luxury class passenger vehicle that is built or modified for the purpose as a limousine 4 sightseeing cars a vehicle for hire designed and constructed to seat seven 7 or more persons used in regularly conducted sightseeing trips which originate from and terminate at a single specified point the destination or route of which is not under the direction of the passenger or passengers transported therein  which is not used as a means of local transportation within the city  and which neither receives nor discharges passengers along its routes 5 taxicabs any vehicle which is rented from a stand in the street or from a private station or garage the destination and route of which is under the direction of the passenger or passengers transported therein and fitted with a taximeter or other mechanical device by which the charge for hire is mechanically calculated by measuring and recording either the distance traveled with such vehicle or the waiting time or both 6 van any vehicle recognized as either a fullsize passenger van or a passenger vehicle on a van or truck chassis the term shall not include a cargo or panel van  8706 manner of advertising no holder of a local business tax receipt to operate a vehicle for hire shall be permitted to advertise such business before the public under any other name or names than the specified name or names recited in the particular local business tax receipt under which such holder is authorized to engage in the business of the transportation of persons for compensation within the city  8706 printed matter appearing on a vehicle for hire except limousines  certain information required  advertising regulated a the name of the company or firm operating a vehicle for hire shall be permanently displayed on both the right and left sides and the rear of the vehicle so that the name shall be plainly visible with lettering at least four 4 inches in height and made to reflect lights shined on them in the dark b each vehicle for hire shall have attached to the outside left rear portion of the vehicle the numbered medallion issued by the city of jacksonville c advertising matter on vehicles for hire shall be attached to the vehicle so that no portion extends below the bumper or beyond either side and so as not to interfere in any manner with full vision rear window of the vehicle  8706 inspection of vehicles it shall be the duty of the local business tax receipt holder to subject the vehicle to a complete and thorough inspection as required by the city of jacksonville written certification of such inspection shall be maintained in the vehicle for hire while operating in the city of jacksonville beach  8706 equipment and safety requirements for vehicles for hire all vehicles in service as vehicles for hire shall have the following equipment on each such vehicle which equipment shall be maintained in good working condition 1 front and rear lights meeting state standards and a dashboard light that will indicate when any of the vehicles doors are not securely closed  2 adequate brakes on all wheels  3 tires of the quality of original equipment as specified by the manufacturer or better  4 speedometer in good working order  5 leather vinyl or some similar nonabsorbent fabric upholstery which can be easily cleaned and shall be free of tears and cuts  6 seatbelts for the driver and all passengers  7 an unexpired a b c type fire extinguisher minimum size of 25 lbs  8 adequate heater and air conditioner  9 all seats in a shuttle vehicle shall be factory installed only  10 except for limousines there shall be no shades blinds or curtains between the rear seat or seats and the drivers seat nor shall any shades blinds or curtains shield the occupants or the forhire driver from observation or obstruct the view rear window all vehicles for hire shall be maintained in a clean wellpainted manner so as to provide a generally good appearance it shall be unlawful to operate any vehicle as a vehicle for hire which does not comply with the provisions of this section  8706 meters required for taxicabs a every taxicab operating as a metered taxicab shall have affixed thereto in operating condition a taximeter b the face of every taximeter shall be visible from the passenger compartment of every taxicab at all times and after sundown shall be illuminated by a suitable light so arranged as to throw a continuous steady light thereon c no taxicab shall be permitted to operate as both a metered and nonmetered zone rate vehicle each vehicle shall be identified in a manner to designate its status as a metered or nonmetered vehicle  8706 designation of taxi stands the city manager is empowered to designate the location of and extent of space for stands to be known as taxi stands on the streets within the city  8706 division 2  obtaining local business tax receipt required it shall be unlawful for any person owning a vehicle for hire to use operate or run or cause or permit any of his agents or employees to use operate or run such vehicle in along over or upon any of the streets of the city or to carry on a business of transporting passengers for hire in such vehicle for hire in the city without first having obtained a local business tax receipt from the city clerk as provided for in this division  8706 application application for a local business tax receipt shall be filed in writing with the city clerk and such application shall set forth the following facts 1 that the applicant is the holder of a permit and medallion issued by the city of jacksonville and same is affixed to each vehicle operated in the city of jacksonville beach 2 that the applicant is the holder of a current vehicle inspection certificate issued by the city of jacksonville for each vehicle operating in the city limits of jacksonville beach  8706 local business tax receipt no company shall be entitled to a local business tax receipt under this division until the company has paid all local business taxes due to the city of jacksonville beach  8706 liability insurance prerequisite to issuance the application for a local business tax receipt shall include proof of a liability insurance policy providing for coverage of not less than fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for property damage one hundred twentyfive thousand dollars $12500000 for any single injury in one accident and three hundred thousand dollars $30000000 for multiple injuries in one accident for each vehicle owned or controlled by such local business tax receipt holder  8706 issuance a the city clerk shall promptly consider the application for a local business tax receipt under this division and if such application meets all of the conditions of this chapter shall cause the local business tax receipt applied for to be issued all local business tax receipts issued in accordance with the provisions of this chapter shall expire on september 30 of each year said local business tax receipts as issued by the city clerk to such applicant shall contain in substance the following 1 those things that are set out in the application for the local business tax receipt  2 the respective number and length of time for which the local business tax receipt is issued  3 any restrictions qualifications conditions and limitations upon which same is issued  8706 posting upon issuance of a local business tax receipt under this division a copy of the same shall be securely placed in each vehicle and kept in plain view of the passengers riding therein in addition the following items must be kept in the vehicle for hire while operating within the city of jacksonville beach 1 vehicle for hire driving permit issued by the city of jacksonville department of environmental & regulatory services  2 florida vehicle registration and proof of current liability insurance  3 valid florida drivers license  4 current vehicle inspection permit  8706 duration no license shall be issued for more than one year and all licenses shall expire on september 30 of each year except as otherwise provided by law  8706 local business tax before the issuance of any local business tax receipt under this chapter the city clerk shall collect thirtysix dollars and thirty cents $3630 per vehicle per license year  8706 division 3  rates and charges schedule of rates to be posted there shall be posted in every vehicle for which a local business tax receipt is issued under this article and in full view of the passengers in plain conspicuous letters a schedule of rates charges and fares which shall be binding upon the operator of the vehicle and any collection of rates fares or charges in excess thereof shall constitute a misdemeanor  8706 charging rates in excess of posted rates no driver of a vehicle for hire shall charge or demand from any customer any sum of money in excess of those rates or charges posted in such vehicle  8706 article iii  rental motorcycles definition motorcycle is hereby defined for the purposes of this article to be a motorized vehicle having two 2 wheels or such vehicle equipped with a singleseat sidecar 1 brake horsepower all motorcycles for rent must be propelled by a power source not exceeding a maximum of one hundred 100 cubic centimeters displacement 2 speed governors each motorcycle for rent shall be governed to a maximum speed of twentyfive 25 miles per hour such method of governing the speed shall be beyond tampering with by the actual operator 3 tandem seats and sidecars a single motorcycle for rent if equipped with a tandem seat shall not carry more than two 2 passengers including the operator if a motorcycle for rent is equipped with a sidecar and a tandem seat then its passenger capacity is limited to three 3 including the operator 4 crash helmet and footwear the rentor shall furnish all passengers of rental motorcycles with approved crash helmets all helmets shall meet the specifications of the state department of public safety all passengers must wear shoes that cover the entire feet with a hard or semihard tennis shoes soles sandal type shoes not covering the top of the foot are not acceptable as adequate footwear 5 persons eligible to rent rental motorcycles shall be rented only to persons legally qualified to operate them which fact shall be determined in advance by the rentor 6 identification marking rental motorcycles shall have the capital letter e painted on the rear of each vehicle the letter e shall be in a contrasting color and shall be at least three 3 inches in height 7 rental hours motorcycles shall be rented only between the hours of  am and  pm 8 information to persons renting the rentor shall inform all persons renting motorcycles that the vehicles may be operated only in the area bordered on the east by the atlantic ocean on the west by third street state road a1a on the south by sixteenth avenue south and on the north by twentieth avenue north seagate avenue and on state road a1a third street and on beach boulevard  and that the speed limit on the ocean beach is ten 10 miles per hour such information shall also be posted in a conspicuous place at the place of business of the rentor in letters not less than two 2 inches in height 9 authority to chief of police to inspect vehicles the chief of police or his representative is authorized to inspect brake horsepower and speed governor requirements of this article 10 land development code footnotes  1  editors note  adopted aug 19 199 repealed ch 34 in its entirety which pertained to zoning and derived from date 7264 1 11 584 7285 1 81985 7289 1 81985 7300 13 1 686
